elements.name: question1
elements.title: Which of the following behaviors generally constitute a breach of duty by the employee?
choices: Refusal of the secretary to clean windows
Acceptance of a free ticket to a concert in return for the promise to bring the boss tea three times an hour
Secretarial work during the day if you are only employed for the night watch
Disclosure of the manufacturing information of a product to an independent inventor
Refusal to work overtime due to poor organization and chronic understaffing
correctAnswer: Secretarial work during the day if you are only employed for the night watch
Disclosure of the manufacturing information of a product to an independent inventor

elements.name: question3
elements.title: Does an employee have to work overtime?
choices: No, the Labor Act expressly prohibits overtime work.
Yes, if they are expressly mentioned in the contract.
Yes, if they are necessary from an operational point of view and reasonable for the employee.
This is decided by the employer on their own authority.
correctAnswer: Yes, if they are necessary from an operational point of view and reasonable for the employee.
